episode_summary: With guest Ben Elton joining Dan, Andrew and James, the team discuss a Teletubbies scandal, cavalry lances lingering in the British Army into the 20th century, a fertility drug made from Pope‑approved nuns’ urine, and the likely illiteracy of Shakespeare’s immediate family. Along the way they detour into children’s TV lore, Vatican finances, and Shakespeare authorship conspiracies.

facts.fact: My fact for this week is the actor who played Tinky Winky was removed from his role because his interpretation of the role was not acceptable.
My fact is that the British Army used lances until 1927.
My fact this week is that in 1962, a baby was successfully conceived thanks to a new fertility drug that contained Pope approved nuns urine.
My fact this week is that Shakespeare's parents and his children were probably illiterate.
